newsitem.title: CANADA: Canadian T-bills open weaker after rate hike.
newsitem.headline: Canadian T-bills open weaker after rate hike.

text.p: Canadian T-bills opened weaker on Thursday after the Bank of Canada hiked short-term interest rates for the first time in more than two years.
In a move that surprised many, the Bank of Canada raised its key bank rate by 25 basis points to 3.5 percent by intervening in the money market.
The move raised the central bank's target range for the call loan or overnight lending rate to 3.0-3.5 from 2.75-3.25 percent.
Canada's three-month when-issued T-bill weakened to yield 3.13 percent from 2.90 percent at Tuesday's close.
